summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, sent on the eve of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial. It is a motivational message to colleagues, asserting that it is never too late for justice and that the trial will reveal Maxwell's sexual exploitation of underage girls. It provides logistical details for attending the trial openings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central accused individual in the referenced trial, described as having sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable kids.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the email, a prosecutor from the Southern District of New York, rallying colleagues on the eve of the Maxwell trial.

events.title: Start of Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The opening of the criminal trial against Ghislaine Maxwell, beginning with peremptory challenges, preliminary instructions, and opening statements.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Florida (mentioned as a contrast to SDNY's approach)
keyFacts: The prosecutor asserts that in the Southern District of New York, it is 'never too late for justice,' contrasting it with an implied criticism of prosecutors elsewhere (like Florida) who might be afraid to charge old sex crimes.
The core allegation is that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls and caused unspeakable harm to vulnerable kids.
The trial is set to begin with opening statements on November 29, 2021, following jury selection procedures.
The email serves as a call to action for colleagues to attend and support the prosecution team at the trial's opening.
